content: Clever sleight-of-hand here that demonstrates the author’s cognitive dissonance, while creating a glaring example of… you guessed it, a fake news article. Look at the the two maps and note the descriptions —Lower Crime Rates / Higher Crime Rates. Isn’t it true that more congested areas have higher crime rates? And those same areas vote at higher levels for Democrats? But Mr. O’Reilly here doesn’t like this obvious correlation as it conflicts with his world view. So to prove that the maps are “fake” he changes the metrics of analysis to states, vs. counties. You really need to watch out for fake news like this!
